title: Planning Act 2022 (No. 50 of 2021) and having regard to section 78(2), hereby
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Maritime Area Consent
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Maritime Area Consent 

(Application Fee) Regulations 2022.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited maritime area consent (application fee) regulation 2022

title: Planning Act 2022 (No. 50 of 2021) and having regard to section 78(2), hereby
heading: 2. (1) These Regulations shall come into operation on 31 July 2022.
text_raw:
2. (1) These Regulations shall come into operation on 31 July 2022. 

(2) In these Regulations “relevant applications” has the meaning assigned to 
it by section 78(4)(b) and (c) of the Maritime Area Planning Act 2021 (No. 50 
of 2021).
text_norm: 2 (1) regulation shall come operation 31 july 2022 (2) regulation relevant application meaning assigned section 78(4)(b) (c) maritime area planning act 2021 (no 50 2021)

title: Planning Act 2022 (No. 50 of 2021) and having regard to section 78(2), hereby
heading: 3. The amount of €25,000 is prescribed as the fee in respect of the making
text_raw:
3. The amount of €25,000 is prescribed as the fee in respect of the making 

of relevant applications. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

28 July, 2022. 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 

Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 2nd August, 2022.
